Name: Brown's Brewing Company's Troy Taproom and Brewery

html_attributions: Brown's Brewing Company's Troy Taproom and Brewery

Reviews.text:
I recently had the opportunity to dine at Brown's Brewing in Troy, and I must say, the location is absolutely stunning. Overlooking the beautiful Hudson River, the restaurant offers both indoor and outdoor seating, making it a perfect spot for enjoying a meal with family and friends. The ambiance is inviting, and the seating arrangements are well thought out, providing a comfortable experience.

Now, let's talk about the food and beer ‚Äì both were exceptional! The menu features a variety of delicious options that cater to different tastes, and the craft beers are some of the best I've had. It's clear that the kitchen and brewing team take pride in their offerings, and it truly enhances the dining experience.

However, I did encounter some issues with the service that I feel compelled to mention. There seemed to be a lack of coordination between the reservation desk and the seating arrangements. Despite seeing several empty tables that were not reserved, we had to wait 45 minutes to be seated. This was frustrating, especially since it appeared that other guests who arrived after us were served much more quickly.

While I want to emphasize that my experience may not reflect the restaurant as a whole, I did feel that the service was somewhat biased. Again, I want to clarify that I am not suggesting any intentional discrimination, but it was disheartening to witness a disparity in service. Regardless, I chose to leave a 20% tip because I wanted to focus on the positive aspects of the meal and leave with good memories.

Overall, while the food and atmosphere at Brown's Brewing are fantastic, the service left something to be desired. Unfortunately, this experience has led me to decide that it will be my last visit. I hope they can address these issues in the future, as the potential for a great dining experience is certainly there.

I have been here at least 10 times over the past 10 years and it‚Äôs always solid. I seek out their cherry raz beer which is outstanding! The ambiance is great too. Indoors, they have a bar and dining area downstairs and more dining upstairs.  I had my engagement dinner and graduation dinner upstairs over in the past and it was great!

Love their outdoor patio area as well. My husband and I came on a Friday evening but still got seated right away outside. We shared the artichoke dip, I had the Moroccan tuna and my hubby had the short rib tacos. 1 star was lost because surprisingly the Moroccan tuna was very bland. It was encrusted in sesame seeds and tasted like‚Ä¶. Nothing. I will admit I don‚Äôt know what Moroccan food is ‚Äúfamous‚Äù for or what to expect but I just imagined in my head something exotic, maybe a little spicy or something and I didn‚Äôt get that.

We‚Äôll definitely be back, I‚Äôll just skip the tuna next time.
My husband and I favorite place to dine in!! Beautiful views and most of all there food  was delicious!!highly recommended to everyone.. ‚ù§Ô∏è

The most amazing wings ever. Awesome place and tons of seating. Super cool to overlook the water with their outdoor deck seating. Definitely go here!!! Lots of menu and beer options. A little on the pricier side though. But they‚Äôre known for the wings so get them!

Lovely evening event in the Hudson room upstairs. We were able to decorate in a simple, elegant fall theme. Staff was attentive, responsive and pleasant, food was excellent - guests were surprised it was more than basic bar food. We had a buffet and a 2 hour bar tab, worked very well to enable lots of mingling, but with seating for everyone, too. The atmosphere was just right, a combination of the social quality of a bar but still a private space. Highly recommend for events. Many thanks to Nicki for managing the event and to Jeff for attending to all of us.

EditorialSummary: Buzzing brewpub on the river pairs American grub with house ales, stouts & more from rotating taps.

Name: Honest Weight Food Co-op

Reviews.text: I have two sons with food allergies so finding baked goods that are safe for them is next to impossible, especially since our previous safe bakery closed. But I was so happy when someone recommended honest weight to me. They made a beautiful cake for my son‚Äôs first birthday and it was absolutely delicious. I had never been to the co op before so I wasn‚Äôt sure what other goods they had and I was so pleased to see that they had other baked goods that were ready to go and free of my children‚Äôs allergens. Needless to say, I will definitely be getting my baked goods from them from now on.

Very impressed with all the Organic selections here and the knowledge of most if not all of the folks working here! I will Definitely be coming back as often as I'm here in the area and Highly recommend shopping here if you buy healthy foods and drinks! I was also Very impressed with the Kombucha on tap and all the flavors, WOW, Fantastic! üòÅüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèº

I honestly don‚Äôt understand what Val‚Äôs problem is with black disabled customers. She has had a consistent attitude with me when I go there. Maybe she does it to others too, but there is a distinct attitude and rudeness that I have witnessed  that she feels she can get away with only with black customers. I notice a new vibe here after shopping here for years, and all I have to say it out with the old and in with the new. I don‚Äôt care how long you‚Äôve been there, if you cannot adjust to the demands of your position and the culture of your shoppers, you need to GO.

Also, the culture of this ‚Äúmember-owned‚Äù store is inherently problematic. Clearly workers are exploited and pressurized and it comes out in their interactions with customers, with supervisors glad to sit back and watch us snark at each other. It‚Äôs toxic.

We had a great time in this store for the first time! We found so many good gluten free options- even in the fresh bakery, which We can never find anywhere else!!! Everyone who worked there was very nice!

It was my first time coming here and I absolutely amazing. I love the store, adored it even. Great selection and the staff were so kind  in contrast to what was said in other reviews but again, this was my experience. I like that this company gives back to the workers and community. I got the pleasure of being checked out by a really helpful and Informative woman that told me a little bit about what a co-op even was. The only thing I noticed, I wouldn't even call it a complaint is the prices. It's just something that maybe shopping here you should be aware of,  it is expensive, Even in contrast to other organic/healthfood stores that I've been to with similar set ups. I got a lot of produce and only produce and it came out to $45. I was  telling the lady that was checking me out in our chat, that we had a local store in my hometown of Kingston called mother Earth, and they're known to be pricey, but I realized after sh  told me my total , that even Mother Earth isnt expensive as here. I would've been able to get the same amount of produce for like $25. It's because the price per pound here is a noticeably more in my opinion. so a suggestion, if you're coming for something prepackaged like almond milk or something, you can get another store go to another store, but if you're coming for locally sourced food come here . Overall, I am grateful that I have a place to come to that reminds me of home and also has the same selection. I mean the the same spitting image selection as the local health food store I'm used to back home. They even had my favorite garlic cashews here. Overall, I'm really happy with my experience. So if you come here you def will be wowed by their selection cause they have a lot of nice things from multi vitamins, peanut butter you can hand press in store,   excellent produce, to local coffee, meat for my fellow carnivores and so much more. I sound like a spokes person but  It really has it all.

EditorialSummary: N/A

Name: Grappa '72

Reviews.text:
I was really hesitant about posting this review for selfish reasons (unearthing this hidden gem), but Grappa '72's amazing staff and chef deserves their recognition! We've finally discovered the BEST Italian restaurant in the Hudson Valley Region, and we've tried A LOT of them! Heck, every one I've tried after this just doesn't compare!

The food was absolutely delicious with large portions and very affordable. I'm salivating just thinking about it! I have serious food allergies and we were served by what seemed to be chef reassuring me that my food was made without any of the allergens I communicated to my waitress! What? I've never had someone go out of their way to make me feel comfortable eating my food without fear of anaphylaxis!

And to top it all off, all the desserts were HOMEMADE and the quality showed through, when we thought the night couldn't have been more perfect, the bartender surprised us with a round of drinks on him! Wow! Anytime I'm in Albany I'll be making reservations!

Good Italian food for the Albany area. Located inside a strip mall the outside of the restaurant isn‚Äôt appealing, but inside is a bit more classy. There‚Äôs lots of traditional Italian dishes to choose from and the service was great.

Exceptional service and a unique dining experience. Started with Meiomi PInot Noir, bread with olive tapenade, oil and vinegar, and loaded arrincini.

For entrees, we ordered the Mahi Mahi special, seafood special and risotto, and scallops.  Everything is delicious.

I'm not sure if Grappa 72 is on well known for desserts, but they should be.  Their Tira Misu is perfection, and even better is their strawberry, ricotta cheesecake, which has a lemon zest.  This work a double espresso is the perfect after dinner treat.

Make a reservation today.  Excellent experience.
I love the atmosphere. The pastas were so tasty. All were friendly and nice. The price was great compared to things I experienced. It's our first choice for our anniversary every year.

Victoria was wonderful.  We sat out on the beautiful patio and she got the music turned on for us right away.  Then she was right on top of our drinks, then extremely helpful with our dinners, and steered us in the right way!! So friendly and we can't wait to go back!! My Salmon/Lentil was delicious; husband's pappardelle with seafood (special) wonderful! The inside is  lovely too and had a trio planning inside.   Can't miss either way!

EditorialSummary: Elegant eatery, tucked away in a strip mall, featuring classic Italian fare, music & grappa.

Name: The City Beer Hall

Reviews.text: Let me tell you...SUPERB pizza! I apologize for not thinking to take a before pic, but was good enough I wanted to take a minute (while I'm still here) to review their pizza. I'm at City Beer Hall and ordered BluPizza's pepperoni pie. This crust is better than NYC!! I can tell real semolina is used and boy does it make a difference. Give it a try!! They have a Gorgonzola pie and I'm sorry now we didn't try that.  But next time for sure! 5 Star pizza!

A new adventure in brunching!!! Me and the girls were a little hungry so this was our choice.

Location is in a weird position so make sure u are a savvy parker if driving.

Was not busy when we went which is always a plus for us. Decided to sit outside since it was warm but not blazing hot. Nice sized patio with gracious seating. There were large blocks to play with as well as corn hole making this family friendly as well as a have fun with ya friends place.

With a brunch entree you receive a complimentary Bloody Mary or Mimosa. The Bloody was HOUSE MADE which I could tell based on the spice level (one can tell horseradish over hot sauce!) and it was GOOD. So good I had two!! My daughter ordered I believe a peach bellini or a mimosa with pineapple juice but did get her complimentary one as well. Grand Princess was graced with a kiddie version - the first one the OJ was not good however the wonderful waitress we had fixed it right up for her and she enjoyed it!

For foods my daughter got the waffle breakfast sammy - BEC on a waffle drizzled (?) with some kind of syrup that was supposed to be a bit spicy I believe. She like it despite it being a little too sweet for her. I had an omelet that was very good. The bacon and sausage inside were tasty - was not a fan of these cheese. We ordered our meals as they were listed so we could try with no modifications. Grand Princess had a waffle with a side of bacon and was very happy.

Service was great. Atmosphere was a vibe. A place that we will return to.

Fantastic place, warm and welcoming.  Christina at the bar had a great personality and the guys working there were very friendly as well.  I am really glad I visited, the burger was char broiled and absolutely delicious, the home made chips were great too.
Great place to hang out with friends, grab a drink & dinner (though would not recommend the lobster roll cuz it was mostly bread).
Loved eating lunch here with friends before dropping them off at the airport. Burgers and beer were wonderful, service was great, loved the decor. Hopefully will have the chance to go back again.

EditorialSummary: Festive beer garden & gastropub in a historic building, where drinks come with free pizza.

Name: Jack's Oyster House

Reviews.text: I stopped by this restaurant for dinner one night while I was staying in Albany. I could clearly see why this place has been around for over 100 years.  The food and drinks were absolutely devine.  The soup and Delmonico steak I ordered was bursting with flavor and they can surely whip up a fantastic cocktail. My server Scout was so sweet, friendly and attentive. The overall appearance of the restaurant is very elegant. I highly recommend checking this place out. I will definitely stop by again the next time I am in the area.

Jacks is the spot! Old world classy, from the servers suits to the rest of the restaurants decor, you can tell this has been an important spot for over a century. We found the service to be great and the food was wonderful. We had a bit of everything and it was all amazing. I‚Äôd highly recommend coming here for dinner if you‚Äôre in town, I certainly plan to be back again soon.

It was an absolutely perfect meal. We're treated to an excellent amuse bouche. The oysters were delicious, from British Columbia and Washington State. The Manhattan chowder was not creamy but probably one of the best I've ever had. The muscles were light and flavorful. The Cornish game hen I had was superb and the pasta was excellent. Can't recommend this place enough.

My daughter and I went to dinner there tonight with a 5:45 reservation. The food has the most unique taste unlike anything I‚Äôve eaten before. The entire waitstaff was extremely professional. The coffee that I had would make Starbucks jealous. Tonight was my first time, it will not be my last. An excellent evening üòä
This place is immaculate with their food, service and atmosphere! I miss coming here with my family! We were always treated well! I hope that they reopen one day!

EditorialSummary: Family-run for a century+, this clubby fixture dishes surf 'n' turf amid dark wood & vintage pics.

Name: Dinosaur Bar-B-Que

Reviews.text: Amazing BBQ and sides!  Try the 2 or 3 meat combo platter for a great variety.  The BBQ fried rice and simmered greens were fantastic.  Great location also right on the river.  Will be back when I'm in the area.

Came here for a work event. Ordered everything family style. It all came in platters and we built our own plates. Great selection of meats and sides. Chicken wings are outstanding! Ribs and brisket were good. Cajun Mac and cheese was great! Fried green tomatoes are the best! Lots of love for this place. Easy walk from local hotels in downtown Troy.

Situated right by the Hudson River, the stunning views enhance the meal. The food is absolutely delicious, especially the brisket, which is perfectly cooked and packed with flavor. Overall, this spot offers a wonderful blend of great food, beautiful scenery, and excellent service. Highly recommended!

Admittedly, I did not eat, but the person I was with did and his food did look good.  The deviled eggs looked amazing.  Good bar selection of liquors and beer.  Very nice bartenders..1 in particular who has been with them for about 13 years..
Place was crowded and there was a wait.  I went for bar seating so no wait for a table.  They do have outdoor seating so evenings would be nice outside by the river.

Had the k pow chicken wings and fried green tomatoes,  cooked to perfection üëå.  All our meals were super Delicious and we were stuffed taking half our plates home. The cheese cake wit caramel whiskey sauce was delightful.  We wil return.

EditorialSummary: Barbecue chain serving Southern-style meats & draft brews in a retro setting (most have live music).

Name: 677 Prime

Reviews.text: We had the Australian wagyu and the A5 with the lobster cannoli and potato skins and the steaks were possibly the best steaks I‚Äôve ever tried. Everything we ate was delicious. The service was exceptional and I highly recommend!
Jon was an excellent server.  Food and atmosphere just does not get any better.  I loved the live music.  This will be a very expensive night but it is worth it if you can swing it.

My wife and I decided to go to 677 prime for our first year anniversary.

Upon sitting, there was a hand written anniversary card on the table waiting for us.

This was our first time at a more high end restaurant and our waiter Joseph helped to make the night so much more comfortable for us.

It was easy to see that he had his hands full, but he still made every attempt he could to stop by our table and check in on us.

We ended up ordering enhanced bread service and the 4Oz. hanging tomahawk steak for 2. After the bread service, there was a long wait for the steak as it was cooked to perfection. (Which it was).

Joseph brought over a complimentary sample of a pasta dish they had for my wife and I, it too was amazing and unexpected. but helped to make the night amazing.

When the steak was brought over, joseph used a torch to blast the black truffle butter onto the steak and potatoes. The presentation was amazing!

Joseph went out of his way to help explain dishes, drinks, and make our first year anniversary a memorable one.

I highly recommend going here for a wonderful meal. The cost is high. but the food is worth it!

My wife and I cant wait to go again!

Amazing food!  Can‚Äôt go wrong with a fillet or stripe steak!  Steaks literally melt in your mouth.   Staff and leadership team were absolutely awesome and helpfully with anything and everything!  Very professional team!!!  Crab Cake and calamari awesome!!

Jeanna was our server tonight, she was very professional and knowledgeable about her job. My wife,daughter myself and host had a wonderful evening there. The food was perfect in taste, temperature and presentation. We ordered a mixture of seafood, steak, and chicken. I had vodka (Tito) with tonic. Each mixed drink was a perfect simulacrum of each other. If you want Hi class dinner with your family, this is the place to go. It was perfect

EditorialSummary: Upscale steakhouse with mahogany accents & colorful art features 400+ wines & weekday bar deals.

Name: Subway

Reviews.text: My order was completely wrong and I‚Äôm starving at work DoorDash can‚Äôt refund my money for 3-5 businesses days so I‚Äôm screw and have to finish my day at work without food because I spent my last $20 on this I‚Äôm so pissed off even the receipt says the right food but the actual food is wrong plus I‚Äôm allergic to onions and that‚Äôs what I got on my sandwich like I‚Äôm so freaking mad and hangry rn it‚Äôs not even funny make the food, review the food, and put it in the right bag what if I just ate it without looking I would‚Äôve been on my way to the hospital I‚Äôm not paying for what ever food you want to give me I‚Äôm pay for the FOOD I ORDER WHAT I PLACE AND WHAT I PUT IN THERE IS WHAT I WANT UGH THIS WHY YOU SHOULDNT GET FOOD FROM THERE!!!!!!!!!

I am so upset!!! I understand it's hard getting workers on the weekend because ..but I have tried so many times on a Saturday to get subs around 3:30 in the afternoon..sign says open but NOONE is there!  I came on a Tuesday same time!! Saw the man in the backroom, me and another lady trying to get subs.  Sign says open!!! Man wouldn't answer the door!  Please get new owners or JUST CLOSE DOWN!!!!

Was about to order, employee didn't smile and seemed to have an attitude/annoyed while I decided what I wanted.

The employee made grumbling noises and did not handle the food with care so I change my mind and walked out.

I will pass this one  üëÜ

Placed an online order through Subway's app. When I showed up, they told me they weren't making anymore orders, despite the order being placed over an hour before their listed closing, and that I would need to contact corporate for a refund because they cannot do it in store. A waste of time.

I am a stickler for nice good customer service. This Subway location went ABOVE AND BEYOND for us. We needed 3 Sandwich platters by noon and I was ordering at 10am. He not only took my order over the phone in the most friendly manner (even with the short notice) They usually ask for 24 hour notice to make sure they have enough bread for the day but he was not mad or upset or made me feel bad about ordering on such short notice. He simply said no problem, took my order and even gave us more toppings for our staff to choose to add more options to the sandwiches. In todays world I fee customer service is tough to find. It was not the case here. Unbelievably nice. And when we picked up the order, the sandwiches were not only ready on time but looked amazing and he bagged them up for easy handling. I can not say enough goo things about this establishment. If you are in the Albany area this Subway has to be YOUR Subway!!!! THANK YOU so much the staff here really enjoyed everything.

EditorialSummary: Casual counter-serve chain for build-your-own sandwiches & salads, with health-conscious options.

Name: Olive Garden Italian Restaurant

Reviews.text: I have been wanting to try this place for a long time. I generally like Italian restaurants a lot. Their salads and sauces are very close to Greek and Turkish. They have a nice palate. I was not wrong, the taste and sauces of the food were very good. I also tasted the pasta on my friend's plate, it was also very good. The atmosphere, relevance, and cleanliness are excellent. I also liked the automatic payment at the table. We did not have to call the waiter and wait. We paid ourselves and left. 5 stars ü§©

I have always wanted to eat here and finally did. Walked in and was very impressed with the people in the front and the bright open bar, it felt happy and very inviting. Heather our waitress was in a word perfect, friendly knowledgeable quick and attentive.The salad was awesome bread sticks were very good my wife got the eggplant I got the lunch chicken alfredo both were very tasty. My only complaint would be the my portion was a very small bowl. All in all I was very impressed with my 1st visit with the people the cleanliness the ambiance and the flavors. We will definitely be back. Thank you

When we arrived the server took our drink order but it took forever for the drinks to come out. When the drinks did come out one was wrong. Food also took a long time to serve.

The restroom was in bad need of service.

Overall the servers were friendly & the food was good.

Full handicapped accessibility is a big plus.
Fabulous service with exquisite cuisine. The starter they offer you as a courtesy is amazing, the salad is wonderful

Believe it or not, I‚Äôd never eaten at an Olive Garden before. This was my first time. I finally tried it. I had an excellent first experience. The food was overall excellent, but what made it special was the excellent service by the server Laura who was excellent in every way. The general manager was excellent as well who checked on me a couple of times and was very welcoming.

-I was sat down right away.
-My food came timely.
-Refills came faster than I could ask for them.
-Food was excellent.
-The place was very quiet.
-Good parking.

Took a few photos to document what I ordered.

5/5 stars.
Highly recommend this location.

EditorialSummary: Lively, family-friendly chain featuring Italian standards such as pastas & salads.

Name: Subway

Reviews.text:
The two men who have made sandwiches for me have been great and both have a good sense of humor. My biggestproblem with this shop is that they don't take coupons. If they did I would probably have 4 six inch subs a week.
I have seen some customers act rudely because they speak on the low side and have accents. The attitude won't get you far - just saying. Nice matters!

There was one older guy working.  He made my order, and cashed me out.   He was very rude.  He only gave me three tomatoes and three small cucumbers on a foot long.  The bread tasted like rubber and was very tough.  When I was checking out, I asked to put points on my rewards card.  I couldn't understand the workers accent, as he was mumbling.  He then proceed to get mad when I swiped my card twice because I had no clue what he wanted.  He kept saying put chip in when I was trying to pay with a gift card.  His attitude was uncalled for, and he was very rude and disrespectful.  I will never visit this Subway again.

My family arrived to the airport and I thought this was a nice location to feed hungry travelers. When ordering, the person serving (an Indian guy) refused serve some cheese and vegetables because we were supposed to order from left to right he would not go back to add some cheese. The guy also got mad at my two teenagers that were trying to order not following the guy's rules. It is the first time that we have to put up with this nonsense. So, my advice is to go to a more polite and service oriented Subway unless you are willing to pay for a low quality service.
Have been going pretty regularly, but for whatever reason, the owner doesn't even greet you or say hello, so I'll go to the Subway on Central Avenue instead.
Subway has gone so far down hill. The sandwiches used to be excellent. Now GARBAGE...My wife and I had a subway club and a Bmt and we both got sick from it.

EditorialSummary: Casual counter-serve chain for build-your-own sandwiches & salads, with health-conscious options.

Name: Red Lobster

Reviews.text: Food was good. Service was a little lacking. Had to ask for cheddar buns. Waiter was just chatting with co workers. Overall not bad

the tiniest biscuits I've ever seen in my life but still good üò≠  they really just charged me ten dollars for these mini size biscuits üòÇstill was worth it .The cake was old  and had a funny taste to it and the mac n cheese had way to much bacon on it  .
Food was AMAZING....Service was spot-on...and we got soOo much food with our order. The food was so tasty. Drinks were delicious üòã

Very good experience! This restaurant make luxury food accessible!
Everything was tasty!
Our waitress was awesome!

The food at Red Lobster was amazing. (I can't believe I'm saying that!) if Red Lobster was like this everytime and everywhere, I would be sold. Unfortunately 9:10 it's horrible. Keylime pie was not good though.

EditorialSummary: Lively chain restaurant serving American seafood standards amid New England-themed decor.

Name: Cafe Madison

Reviews.text: We stopped in on a Friday mid morning in September for brunch with a group of 6.  We were seated in the dining area immediately. Our server was friendly and attentive. The food was good. I didn‚Äôt have any alcoholic beverages but a couple in the group had bloody Mary‚Äôs and said they were good. Overall very nice experience.

This place has been around for so long and I believe I've only been once when it was very small. I went on 10/14 (holiday so a lot of people off work) and there was quite a bit of a wait (25-30 mins for 2) but it did not disappoint. I cannot remember waitresses name but she was great. The food was outstanding and the upgrade to the restaurant is beautiful. Definitely would go again.

The meal was decent overall, but the pricing doesn't align with the quality of the food. Like other reviewers have mentioned, the food arrives lukewarm, and the home fries certainly don't taste or look homemade. It feels like the restaurant is cutting too many corners while still charging for an 'experience' that doesn't deliver.

On the bright side, the staff is warm and does their best to be attentive, though they seem stretched thin due to understaffing.

One major concern is the bee issue on the patio. It‚Äôs disappointing that patrons are left to decide if they‚Äôre willing to "take the risk" to dine outside. This situation reflects a lack of responsibility on the part of the restaurant, where simple accountability could vastly improve the customer experience.

Caf√© Madison is the spot for a solid Sunday morning brunch! Despite the 30-minute wait (which was well worth it), the vibe was cozy and inviting. I went all out with the Cheesesteak Omelette and Eggs Benedict ‚Äî and trust me, both dishes hit it out the park. The omelette was packed with tender steak and gooey cheese, cooked perfectly with every bite. The Eggs Benedict had the silkiest hollandaise, and that poached egg was chef‚Äôs kiss!

If you‚Äôre looking for a brunch spot that‚Äôll satisfy your soul and leave you thinking about breakfast all week, Caf√© Madison‚Äôs where it‚Äôs at. Pro tip: Get there early if you don‚Äôt wanna wait, but if you do, just know it‚Äôll be worth every second. üëåü•öüíØ

Update 10/26/24 (to add a new image and drink):
My partner and I have been coming here every weekend since December 2023. The reason being that we love the staff and the great food!

One weekend they had a Taylor Swift themed weekend where they served her favorite dishes and played her music all weekend. It was so much fun, even for casual listeners of her music.

The food is amazing. We usually get omelettes or the standard breakfast. Sometimes we also order the special so we can try it out.

For drinks- We get a champagne dream (on recommendation of staff). We primarily come to the bar, where you can always find seating and great service. Drew (bartender, pictured serving his drink creations) has been amazing and has even been learning to make his own drinks. He has some incredible "Drew Specials," such as a Clover Club with a raspberry twist (off-menu items, as shown in the first attached image) and a few others he's made for us (like the citrusy Chamomile Gin Fizz in 3rd image with the citrus rind, or the Blueberry Sunset in 4th and 5th images with red transitioning to a lighter color, and the raspberry cosmo in 6th image with the dark citrus slice).

We will continue to come here every weekend, as it's close to home and always has great food, drinks, and friendly staff.

Thank you, Cafe Madison, for always providing a great weekend brunch experience for me and my partner. We sincerely appreciate you!

------
Original:
Always a great place to go for brunch! Amazing drinks, great food, and awesome staff. Love the new location! So spacious and beautiful.

The California Avocado Omelette is always delicious. Peach Bellini, Champagne Dream, and seasonal drinks (like the Sunrise Mimosa and Apple Pie Mimosa) are always on point.

Mario C, Emily, Drew, and Sarah are a great servers (and Aki, and other staff were great, too) and looking forward to coming back next weekend!

EditorialSummary: Comfy breakfast-&-lunch spot with wood floors, floral banquettes & long waits for weekend brunch.

Name: The Ruck

Reviews.text:
In town on business and did some Yelping to see what was good in the area. I checked out this place and their menu then made the decision. Here's how it went...

Atmosphere/Appearance: Right off of a city street is this gem. It's got a good mixture of a dive bar and a decent pub. They were in the middle or doing some renovations so I'm excited to see what the new interior looks like when they're all done! For now there's lots of darker woods all over along with a decent bar rail right near the front entrance. Along the back wall is a very long bench seat paired with tables that you can push together to form one long one. It's a college town so it was a bit loud inside, but you kind-of expect that from these types of bars.

Service: Katie took great care of us. She was so friendly, charismatic, funny and just overall brought an extra level of joy to our dining experience.

Food: I saw wings on the menu so l went for it. They had a list of flavors with some interesting names. I went with the "Brother Rob Hot" which is supposed to be some super hot sauce, but it wasn't. It had a good amount of eat and great flavor, but it's nothing to be afraid of. Another flavor I got was the Buffalo Garlic Parmesan. It was delicious and my preferred sauce over the others. Next up was Medium. Medium was medium. I also got the chance to try their Honey BBQ which was a great deep, tangy flavor with natural-tasting sweetness. Last, but not least was the "Sauce of the Day" a sweet, tangy, honey-based selection. It was okay, but quite different. The wings were also big, juicy and not fried so much to where they were burnt. Their house-made bleu cheese was fantastic and went perfectly with the spiciness of the wings.

Value: 20 big juicy wings with bleu cheese, celery and carrots will run you $28.00. Given the size of them and that I can get more than 1 FULL MEAL out of them makes them worth it for sure.

I'd totally come back here specifically for the wings. It's a nice chill place to hang out with your friends or coworkers to get a beer, some food and take a load off for the day.

The Buckshot Burger was OUTSTANDING. Two Wagyu patties topped with onion rings, bacon, and BBQ sauce. This place had a lot of activity on a Monday night. Seems like a very good place to hang out and watch a game. Lots of options on the menu. Good service. Walkable distance from most major hotels in Troy.

Saturday lunch date. New place for me. Parking may be an issue on busy days but otherwise a gem of Troy. Lovely dark wood, friendly, and cool vibe here. Staff is amazing . Food delicious. Had the legend chicken sandwich, my friend had the mushroom Swiss burger. All was cooked perfectly. Loved the bacon jam on the chicken sandwich. Come here and get treated well. 30+ beers on tap. Awesome time. Would definitely come back.
This was my first visit.  Loved it!  After business hours you can park in the lot across the street.  Very convenient.  Not really a dive or ruin pub, but really good local pub.

This place has been a solid place to enjoy beers in Troy for well over a decade of me knowing about it. The prices have climbed with the economy so your Wing Burger is a bit more but the food is good and still competitive with the locals.

They have a cute outdoor patio, fun keg urinals, and shuffle board to play in the back. Plenty of space to enjoy an after work happy hour and I even saw some decent NA brews for anyone needing to DD.

The decor keeps to the Ruck standards and the staff are still welcoming and friendly. Comfortable to enjoy if you are a regular or if you drop in from time to time.

On a bigger plus they allow your pups to join you which makes another pup friendly destination in Troy NY.

Thank youüòÅ

EditorialSummary: Rustic, wood-paneled pub featuring craft beers & a menu of burgers & eclectic bar bites.

Name: Latham '76 Diner

Reviews.text: Really just an excellent diner.  Service was fast and courteous. Food was excellent, shortly after we arrived a school bus full of A soccer team arrived. They didn't as a beat.  It's nice seeing a business, that knows its business, and can handle situations as they arise.

My date and I stumbled upon this place Friday night and I must say we were very pleased with the atmosphere and the ambiance the customer service was A1 and our server was so sweet I forgot to get her name but she was very friendly and polite the food was really good my only issue was my broccoli was bought out last and  the broccoli was cold the butter wouldn't even melt on it I didn't complain about it but that was my only issue other than that the customer service was exceptional we will definitely be coming backüòä

Stopped in here for breakfast on my way to the airport. Everything was absolutely amazing. Food, service, atmosphere...all perfectly spot on. I had the English muffin with Canadian bacon (don't remember the exact name of the sandwich), it was divine. Also had a piece of baklava cheesecake before I left that may very well be the best dessert I have ever had in my life. Simply perfect. Thoroughly recommend, do yourself a favor and go enjoy a slice of your dessert of choice. Chefs kiss.

Great diner food! I had a double bacon and double cheese omlette. Was a good portion and good value. Wish the bacon was crispier, but still really good. My wife had the Athenian omlette, and she said it was fantastic.

The waitress nicked named "Turkey," is a howl. You'll be lucky to have her. She has been there since 1975!!

A definite must stop!

A quaint place that exudes a country charm to it! The food was delicious ! The pancakes and the milk shakes were amazing! The waffle could be made more crispier but overall wonderful place! Highly recommend it especially with kids!

EditorialSummary: Old-fashioned outpost for hearty, traditional American comfort food dishes, plus a daily breakfast menu.

Name: Van's

Reviews.text:
Yummy!
They serve authentic Vietnamese dishes.
I ordered pho and pork with vermicelli. The pho is not too salty nor overly flavorful, but it's just right to enjoy.
The vermicelli dish with pork is really huge with a nice Vietnamese flavor (lemongrass and a bit of fish sauce).
I love this vermicelli dish!!
Iced coffee with condensed milk is awesome as well.
Highly recommended!

I went on a busy lunch time on Sunday. I was very impressed with both the service and my food. I ordered chicken with rice vermicelli and it was a very large amount of food! It was also incredibly delicious. One order us probably enough for 2.
There is only 1 waiter and 1 server for an incredibly busy restaurant, but do not let that fool you. They both did an amazing job! Very quick service, and very polite. I will now bring my friends and family here!
Spring rolls are very delicious and crunchy.  The vermicelli pork is okay.  The meat was a little dry.

Pho soup üçú was a The soup was unsweetened, not salty, excellent traditional soup, the meat was ok, the sprouted women were not very fresh. The siera sauce was good, the waiter ignored us for 5 minutes but then they still came to our table, which we really didn‚Äôt like, and the service itself is good for a lover of true and real pho, you should visit this place

The food was so good here. The service was quick and the staff are very friendly + attentive. I only gave the atmosphere 4/5 stars since I think it was a little empty inside, decoration wise but other than that it would be a 5! If you want authentic Vietnamese cuisine please come here. The coconut pudding (a dessert that was only $3!!!) is to die for (I forgot the name of it).

EditorialSummary: Outsized portions of pho, meat & noodle dishes are the draw in this stark Vietnamese storefront.

Name: Bruegger's Bagels
FullAddress: 279 Troy Rd, East Greenbush, NY 12144, USA

Reviews.text:
I'm so upset this morning I decided to get breakfast for my co workers and walked in the staff was amazing and friendly I got a sandwich and bagels for my co workers and as I'm eating my sandwich I see pure green/blue in my sandwich i open it up and the egg is completely covered in mold! I almost puked the fact that another human being can willingly put that on another person's sandwich with I'll intent blows my mind. What is this world coming too. I couldn't even get a picture of the side that had the most mold on it I'm sick that I ate the other half. I hope the person that did this finds peace in their heart cause there's no way that they didn't see it putting it on the sandwich. So much evil in this world. The picture doesn't even do it justice what was shown and the other side that was already eaten was worse. The fact that someone deliberately wants to hurt someone and thinks that's okay to do has serious mental health problems and is a danger to society.

Update i have reached out and no one has gotten back to me. Hence the review

The person at the register was great, then we waited‚Ä¶and waited‚Ä¶and waited. They lost our order and then said they found it and gave us a bag. It was definitely NOT what we ordered but we didn‚Äôt have time to go through getting the order remade. Bagels were good, hard to judge the rest since it wasn‚Äôt what we ordered. We understand that they were busy but a little more care and actually listening when we told them what we had ordered and making sure that was what they gave us instead of just handing us whatever bag they found would have been appreciated. Not the best first experience with Bruegger‚Äôs. Might be our last.

This is my go-to chain for a delicious BLT on their amazing Parmesan bagel. I absolutely love it! This particular location has the added convenience of a drive-through, which is a big plus. Like all its locations the coffee is horrible. I do wish they had some seating available, as it's always nice to have the option to sit and enjoy your meal. Despite that, the quality of the food and the drive-through convenience keep me coming back. Highly recommend!

This is the worst Bruegger‚Äôs I‚Äôve ever been to. It usually takes a ridiculous amount of time so I‚Äôve started ordering about half an hour before I get there. I waited for 40 minutes and still didn‚Äôt have my order ready. The workers are incredibly rude and don‚Äôt even give you the time to ask about it. Then they didn‚Äôt have the bagel I ordered and who knows, maybe they would have had it 40 minutes ago when I ordered it but rather than call ahead they just wait. And even when they do have it the bagels aren‚Äôt good. This place is awful I would recommend going to literally any other bagel place before this one.

In my opinion,  the best Bagels in the capital district.  They boil them.  You can taste the difference.  They also offer a few gormet flavors, for slightly more money.  The standard flavors are still my favorite!

EditorialSummary: Cafe/bakery chain preparing small-batch, New York-style bagels, plus breakfast & lunch sandwiches.

Name: Recovery Sports Grill
FullAddress: 62 New Scotland Ave, Albany, NY 12208, USA

Reviews.text: The entire crew took care of an entire Women's tackle football team. They all went above and beyond making this an amazing experience! The food was amazing! The manager was awesome and the entire crew was helpful and patient with our entire team! The Maine Mayhem know where we are coming again! You were all amazing!

Not busy at all but ended up having to seat ourselves and after being ignored by 2 waitresses we got our own menus. Probably would have walked out but only restaurant that was near hotel. Asked for medium rare burger and arrived more well done. Brioche bun grilled but soggy from too much butter added. Subbed French fries for mashed potatoes and they were left too long under heat lamp and had a film over them.
Fish and chips scored better. Fries crispy and two pieces of fish were small but crispy as well.
Waitress kept disappearing so refill on drinks not an option or would have been there all night. I would understand if the place was packed with customers but it wasn‚Äôt.

We were able to get a party of 5 to watch the game in last minute. Particularly we got the football game we wanted to watch when we asked. While there was abit of time inbetween the food, it was delicious along with the manager and server being courteous. Would stop by again

Placed our order on line. 4 meals and only 1 was correct.We had 2 orders of salmon which was supposed to come with mash potatoes and seasonal vegetables. The salmon came with nothing else. The burger was supposed to come with waffle fries. No waffle fries came with the burger. It was accompanied by kids Craft Mac and cheese. Which wasn‚Äôt available as a choice. The chicken sandwich and fries was the only meal that was correct. I tried to call and address these problems and no one answered the phone. I made 3 attempts to call and nothing.

Used to love coming here but the last few times have been a miss. Was served hair in our food before, service isn‚Äôt always the greatest. Last night I was served raw chicken, service was a little better than usual but still not amazing considering what I was served. Still charged for the rest of our drinks and the chef didn‚Äôt even bother to come out. The waitress apologized which I appreciated but the kitchen staff just stared as us from the back. Definitely won‚Äôt be visiting this location again.

EditorialSummary: Upbeat restaurant with a sporting theme, showing live games & serving classic American comfort food.

Name: El Loco Mexican Cafe

Reviews.text:
Great little Mexican restaurant in a chill part of Albany. Cocktails were good and the food was definitely on-point. The restaurant isn't that large, so I would highly recommend reservations.

If you're in town and have a craving for Mexican, try this place out.

This is a very nice, cozy place to get some very delicious food! The staff is very passionate about the service and food! House made margaritas are hand made and not from a premixed bottle. I will be back again
Really tasty food and very friendly staff. Chef must be the best in town. Highly recommended when you are in Albany. Great prices as well.

The best Mexican food I have ever eaten! Great Margaritas which were authentic and strong, not a huge goblet of sweet and sour mix. The Tamales were our favourite, delicious flavour and texture and great side dishes. Big portions, amazing staff, reasonable price and great flavour!

I've been coming to El Loco for more then 25 years with my wife. It's consistently been providing quality authentic Mexican cuisine. We are now vegan and still find healthy authentic options. We're thankful for 40+ years in business

EditorialSummary: Festive cantina serving Mexican & Southwestern faves, from tacos & margaritas to happy-hour tapas.

Name: dp An American Brasserie

Reviews.text: Attached to a hotel, this restaurant is unassuming but hellooooo....excellent food & service. I ordered a gin martini & got a ros√©. Delish. I was told about the sister restaurant menu they also serve & i ordered the Indonesian main lobster fried rice. Ooooo

This place always serves great food. The Indonesian noodles are a winner. I‚Äôve also had the farro which is great. Great beverage selection too ‚Äî and the staff are friendly and knowledgeable. Good vibes and nice space.

Wonderful surprise in downtown Albany.  Really fabulous food:   Broccoli rabe and hummus; short ribs and a special monkfish. All very tasty with great flavors and spices.  Very nice ambience.  Excellent service.

The restaurant is attached the hotel I'm staying at. And I was too lazy to go anywhere else that's is how it was chosen lol but anywho friendly staff to great ya and take your order. They gave me 15% off for staying at the hotel as well.
Started off with soup and was a sweet potato with curry blend bisque type soup. Interesting blend of flavors in a good way.
Also ordered the Pan Roasted Gulf of Maine Salmon with carrots and brussels sprouts, Farro, Pistou
The salmon was cooker to perception with a crispy side which was excellent.
Would definitely come back and order the salmon and soup. The soup was a special of the day.

Excellent food that does not break the wallet. The best part is that you can also order from the Yono's menu. They have a great wine list. The bartender is also very knowlegable and makes excellent cocktails!!! The potstickers are great! I loved the octopus! THey even do little specials if you call in advance and they write happy birthdya or congratulations on the menu for your table! Great service! A go to spot in Albany

EditorialSummary: Buzzy spot offering French classics, burgers & comfort bites, as well as an extensive wine list.

Name: Dino's

Reviews.text: Dino's Pizza is run but some really arrogant and obnoxious owners. They think that because most of their clientele are SUNY Albany students that they can treat people however they want. I've experienced and seem them lying to customers about orders made and prices charged. On top of all that, the pizza isn't even that great. Do not go there. DC Pizza among others is much better.

One of the best pizza's in Abany!!!

I certainly don't understand the poor reviews below, because I've been there numerous amount of times and never had any problem with the product nor the staff.
Perfect after bar, quick, reasonably priced and new sitting area is great and convenient!

My message to the owners, is not to worry about irresponsibly drunk customers and do the same outstanding job!!!

See you soon...
One of my kids said it was the best pizza they've ever had. The garlic knots were also top notch.

Looking for a midnight snack, look no further because Dino Pizzeria opens really late for partygoers, street dwellers, or night owls. While most restaurants are closed, you can count on a reliable slice of pizza. Here at Dino Pizzeria, you can find all sorts of pizzas, ranging from regular cheese pizza to a buffalo wing (boneless of course) pizza. A good thing about this place is that the slices are bigger than you average slices and the price is pretty affordable. I sometimes come here a regular slice since I want to stay under budget, and for $2, you get a giant slice that fills any night dwellers stomachs. One problem I would say about this place is that it gets really stuffy at times, even with the door open, so it‚Äôs best if you grab and go. However, they have pretty decent pizzas and some stellar pizza and wings deals.
Dino's pizza is simply amazing. Their pizza is delicious !!, great customer service, very polite workers:)  also their subs, pastas and etc. are very good! Love it there :)

EditorialSummary: Corner parlor with a late-night following doles out traditional & specialty pies plus subs & wings.
